alert.note: Alert for Northampton; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 2:33AM EDT until September 30 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, high rip current risk. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach, and Northampton County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM this morning to 1 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect up to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Breaking waves will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
